text: for the Sun it's been a pretty busy week
cosmically speaking enhance pictures
from NASA's Solar Dynamics Observatory
proving the point you can see here on
the left a huge explosion of radioactive
material a solar flare over the last few
days there have been more than half a
dozen similar eruptions look at this
image particles of superheated energy
shooting thousands of kilometers out
into space it's not just about pretty
pictures of course these solar winds
travel through the cosmos and can reach
us here on earth it's warm satellite
communications power grids even air
travel could be affected if the flares
are particularly strong at the very
least you may get to see a wonderful
display like the aurora borealis or
Northern Lights this is what happens
when solar winds hit the Earth's upper
atmosphere these latest solar flares
don't appear to be aimed in our
direction so we can breathe a little
easy but they are an extraordinary sight
nonetheless Tim Allman BBC News
